member.name: ISyncMgrSynchronize.EnumSyncMgrItems
member.summary: Obtains the interface for the items that are handled by a registered application.
member.param: The address of the variable that receives a pointer to a valid interface.

returns.para: This method supports the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_UNEXPECTED, and E_OUTOFMEMORY, and the following:

listheader.description: The enumeration interface is returned successfully.

The enumeration interface object is returned successfully, but some items are missing. When this success code is returned, the synchronization manager does not remove any stored preferences for ItemIds that are not returned in the enumerator.

member.name: ISyncMgrSynchronize.GetHandlerInfo
member.param: A pointer to a structure.

returns.para: This method supports the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_UNEXPECTED, and E_OUTOFMEMORY, and the following:

member.name: ISyncMgrSynchronize.GetItemObject
member.summary: Obtains an interface on a specified item that a registered application handles.
member.param: An identifier for a requested item.
An identifier for a requested interface.
An address of a variable that receives a pointer to a requested interface.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The requested interface is not found.

member.name: ISyncMgrSynchronize.Initialize
member.summary: Called by the synchronization manager in a registered application handler to determine whether the handler processes the synchronization event.
member.param: Reserved; must be 0 (zero).
The enumeration values that describe how a synchronization event is initiated.
The size of the lpCookie data, in bytes.
A pointer to the token that identifies an application. This token is passed when an application invokes the synchronization manager programmatically.

returns.para: This method supports the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_UNEXPECTED, and E_OUTOFMEMORY, and the following.

listheader.description: Application handler does not process a synchronization event.

member.name: ISyncMgrSynchronize.PrepareForSync
member.summary: Allows a registered application to display any user interface, and perform any necessary initialization before the method is called. For example, an application such as the Microsoft Outlook email client may need to display the password dialog box to enable a user to log on to a mail server.
member.param: The number of items in the array pointed to by pItemIDs.
An array of item IDs that a user chooses to synchronize.
A handle to the parent HWND that a registered application should use for any user interface element displayed. This value may be NULL.
Reserved. Registered applications should ignore this value.

returns.para: This method supports the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_UNEXPECTED, and E_OUTOFMEMORY, and the following:

member.name: ISyncMgrSynchronize.SetItemStatus
member.summary: Called by the synchronization manager in a registered application's handler to change the status of an item in the following two cases: between the time the handler has returned from the method and called the callback method, or after the handler has returned from the method but has not yet called the callback method.
member.param: Identifies the item with changed status.
The new status for the specified item taken from the enumeration.

returns.para: This method supports the standard return values, E_INVALIDARG, E_UNEXPECTED, and E_OUTOFMEMORY, as well as the following:

member.name: ISyncMgrSynchronize.SetProgressCallback
member.summary: Sets the interface. Registered applications use this callback interface to give status information from within the and methods.
member.param: A pointer to interface the registered application uses to provide feedback to SyncMgr about the synchronization status and to notify SyncMgr when the synchronization is complete.

returns.para: This method supports the standard return values, E_INVALIDARG, E_UNEXPECTED, and E_OUTOFMEMORY, as well as the following:

listheader.description: Synchronization callback interface was successfully set.

member.name: ISyncMgrSynchronize.ShowError
member.summary: Called by the synchronization manager in a registered application handler when a user double-clicks an associated message in the error tab.
member.param: A handle to the parent HWND that a registered application should use to display a user interface. This value can be NULL.
An error identifier that is associated with this error message. This value is passed in the method.

returns.para: This method supports the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_UNEXPECTED, and E_OUTOFMEMORY, and the following:

member.name: ISyncMgrSynchronize.ShowProperties
member.summary: Called by the synchronization manager when a user selects an item in the choice dialog box, and then clicks the Properties button.
member.param: The parent HWND for any user interface that a registered application displays to set properties. This value can be NULL.
The item ID for properties that are requested.

returns.para: This method supports the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_UNEXPECTED, and E_OUTOFMEMORY, and the following.

listheader.description: The properties dialog for an item is handled successfully.

member.name: ISyncMgrSynchronize.Synchronize
member.summary: Called by the synchronization manager once for each selected group after the user has chosen the registered applications to be synchronized.
member.param: A handle to the parent HWND the registered application should use for any user interface elements that it displays. This value may be NULL.

returns.para: This method supports the standard return values, E_INVALIDARG, E_UNEXPECTED, and E_OUTOFMEMORY, as well as the following:

member.name: ISyncMgrSynchronize
member.summary: Exposes methods that enable the registered application or service to receive notifications from the synchronization manager.
